creator: Quentin Tarantino
work: Pulp Fiction / Kill Bill / Inglourious Basterds

axioms.name: Artistic Theft
axioms.statement: Good artists borrow, great artists steal. Reference is not homage but absorption; genre elements become fully yours through transformation.

axioms.name: Dialogue as Action
axioms.statement: Dialogue IS action if done correctly. A conversation can carry more tension, stakes, and narrative momentum than any action sequence.

axioms.name: Genre as Conversation
axioms.statement: Genre is a conversation, not a constraint. Sub-genres provide structural scaffolding and audience expectations that enable rather than limit creative freedom.

axioms.name: Chronology as Choice
axioms.statement: Chronology is a choice, not an obligation. The order of telling exists to serve resonance, not merely to report sequence.

axioms.name: Rubber Band Suspense
axioms.statement: Suspense is a rubber band. Stretch it and stretch it; the pleasure is in the stretching. Violence should be deferred until deferral itself becomes unbearable.

axioms.name: 75/25 Rule
axioms.statement: 75% of stories work better linear; 25% gain resonance from non-linear telling. Know which you have.
derivations: Test for resonance gain before scrambling
Not on a crusade against linear storytelling

levels.name: Film
elements: Must resolve all threads, though not necessarily in chronological order

levels.name: Chapter
levels.description: Named/titled segment with its own arc
elements: Must function as semi-autonomous unit while serving whole

levels.name: Beat
levels.description: Moment of tension escalation or power shift
elements: Often invisible to characters but palpable to audience

core_algorithms.name: Non-Linear Chronology Algorithm
core_algorithms.purpose: Determine whether and how to scramble story chronology for maximum resonance
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
INPUT: story_in_chronological_order
QUESTION: Does scrambling create meaning?
TEST: Does order-change reveal character differently? Create dramatic irony? Produce surprise + inevitability? Generate thematic resonance?
IF any criterion stronger: Consider non-linear, apply 75/25 rule
IF no criterion stronger: Tell linearly

core_algorithms.name: Dialogue-as-Action Protocol
core_algorithms.purpose: Structure dialogue scenes to carry tension and stakes typically assigned to action sequences
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
SETUP: Seemingly casual, tangential conversation
STAKES_REVELATION: True stakes become gradually apparent through subtext
POWER_EXCHANGE: Control shifts between participants, camera follows power
STRETCHING: Tension stretched beyond comfort, violence anticipated but deferred
RELEASE: Brief, shocking violence or philosophical resolution

core_algorithms.name: Tension Through Deferral System
core_algorithms.purpose: Maximize suspense by announcing threats early and deferring payoff as long as possible
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
PHASE 1: Announce threat explicitly or implicitly
PHASE 2: Deny immediate resolution, discuss other things
PHASE 3: Stretch through politeness, maintain social facade
PHASE 4: Incremental revelation, dramatic irony deepens
PHASE 5: Breaking point approach, facade untenable
PHASE 6: Release - violence brief, shocking, contrasts with buildup

core_algorithms.name: Chapter/Segment Architecture
core_algorithms.purpose: Create semi-autonomous narrative segments that work independently while serving the whole
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
TEST_1: Could segment work as standalone short film?
TEST_2: Does it enrich understanding of other segments?
TEST_3: Why is this segment placed HERE in sequence?
VALIDATION: Each segment must pass all three tests

core_algorithms.name: Genre Pastiche Management
core_algorithms.purpose: Integrate multiple genre references at varying levels of visibility
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
LEVEL 1: Invisible absorption (viewer need not recognize)
LEVEL 2: Textured homage (recognizable to fans, works without)
LEVEL 3: Explicit quotation (rewards recognition)
LEVEL 4: Meta-commentary (comments on source)
BALANCE: 70% Level 1-2, 30% Level 3-4

core_algorithms.name: Mexican Standoff Pattern
core_algorithms.purpose: Create equilibrium situations where multiple parties have incompatible goals and any action triggers mutual destruction
core_algorithms.pseudocode:
PHASE 1: CONVERGENCE - Multiple armed parties, incompatible goals
PHASE 2: EQUILIBRIUM - Weapons raised, stasis through terror
PHASE 3: ESCALATION - Dialogue increases tension, new information
PHASE 4: RESOLUTION - Carnage, negotiated exit, external interruption, or philosophical resolution

diagnostic_questions.question: Have you written the story in chronological order first?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Yes - chronological draft exists before scrambling

diagnostic_questions.question: Does non-linear arrangement add resonance, or just complexity?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Adds resonance through dramatic irony, character revelation, or thematic connection

diagnostic_questions.question: Which segments gain from displacement?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Specific segments identified with clear resonance justification

diagnostic_questions.question: Does scrambled order create productive dramatic irony?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Audience knows more than characters, creating tension

diagnostic_questions.question: Apply 75/25 test: Is this in the 25% that benefits from non-linearity?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Clear case for non-linear treatment established

diagnostic_questions.question: Can your dialogue scenes carry the tension usually assigned to action?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Dialogue scenes sustain 10+ minutes with escalating stakes

diagnostic_questions.question: Do your characters have distinctive voices capable of sustaining long scenes?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Each character has identifiable speech patterns and worldview

diagnostic_questions.question: Have you identified your 'Sicilian scene' where dialogue becomes life-or-death?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: At least one scene where weaker character gains moral victory through speech

diagnostic_questions.question: What threat is announced early?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Threat established in first act, deferred throughout

diagnostic_questions.question: How long can you defer the payoff?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Buildup to violence ratio is 5:1 or greater

diagnostic_questions.question: Where are the 'politeness becomes terrifying' moments?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Social facade masks mortal stakes in identified scenes

diagnostic_questions.question: Which sub-genres inform this work?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Multiple sub-genres identified with integration strategy

diagnostic_questions.question: If mixing genres, where are the collision points?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Collision type identified (sequential, layered, tonal whiplash, hybrid)

maps_to: Ovid's Metamorphoses - non-linear linking masters, tonal modulation, linking devices
Larry David - dialogue as action/conflict, extended scenes, collision concept, digressive monologue

key_constraints: Chronology: IF scramble creates irony/resonance -> scramble; IF scramble just complicates -> stay linear; Apply 75/25 rule
Dialogue: Tangent -> Tension -> Power Shift -> Defer -> Release; The band stretches and stretches
Violence: Announce threat -> Defer resolution -> Brief payoff; Buildup:Violence ratio = 5:1 or greater
Chapters: Each works alone AND contributes to whole; Title cards signal tonal/POV shifts
Scene Power: WHO controls NOW? WHEN does power shift? HOW does camera reflect power holder? WHY is violence deferred? WHAT tangent reveals character?
